question: Which of the following are found in Diamond and Emerald?
explanation: Diamond is a solid form of the element carbon with its atoms arranged in a crystal structure called diamond cubic. Emerald is a gemstone and a variety of the mineral beryl (Be<sub>3</sub>Al<sub>2</sub>(SiO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>6</sub>) colored green by trace amounts of chromium and sometimes vanadium.
